title: Various documentation for SIMD stuff is out of date

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
* [ ] https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/aarch64/index.html points you to a `stdsimd` feature and issue https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/27731, but that issue says it's tracking `coresimd`, perhaps the docs there need to change. Except that at [the bottom of the issue](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/27731#issuecomment-429249091) it's apparently the case that the issue itself has run its course and we need a new tracker that's got the modern state of things figured out.
* [x] https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/index.html the arch links are broken (but the module links work). Those URLs just need to get updated
* [x] https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/arch/x86_64/struct.__m64.html also points to what it calls `stdsimd` but has a different tracking number (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/48556) and the issue it points to is now closed, so that needs to be updated to point to a live issue that actually includes it.
